sn56.22:1.1: “Mendicants, there are ascetics and brahmins who don’t truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.22:1.2: I don’t regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables don’t realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and don’t live having realized it with their own insight.
sn56.22:2.1: There are ascetics and brahmins who do truly understand about suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.
sn56.22:2.2: I regard them as true ascetics and brahmins. Those venerables realize the goal of life as an ascetic or brahmin, and live having realized it with their own insight.”
sn56.22:3.1: That is what the Buddha said.
sn56.22:3.2: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
sn56.22:4.1: “There are those who don’t understand suffering
sn56.22:5.1: And they don’t know the path
sn56.22:5.2: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
sn56.22:5.4: as well as the release by wisdom.
sn56.22:5.6: they continue to be reborn and grow old.
sn56.22:6.1: But there are those who understand suffering
sn56.22:7.2: that leads to the stilling of suffering.
sn56.22:7.3: They’re endowed with the heart’s release,
sn56.22:7.4: as well as the release by wisdom.
sn56.22:7.6: they don’t continue to be reborn and grow old.”
